page.title: 17AMPORT HOUSE.
page.content: Amport House was built in 1857 and was the home of the Marquesses of Winchester until it was sold at the end of World War 1. During the 'thirties it was owned by Col. Sofer- Whitburn until, in 1939, it became the Headquarters of RAF Maintenance Command. The H.Q. moved to Andover in 1961 and the house is now the RAF Chaplains' School. It is an imposing, gabled Victorian mansion in the Elizabethan style standing amid park- land that includes two redwood trees, cedars and copper beeches. Part of the garden is old. The knot garden depicts details from the Paulet family's coats of arms. The avenues of pleached limes are fascinating. The house's main facade faces south, overlooking the grdens laid out by Sir Edwin Lutyens, advised by Gertrude Jekyll. Ponds, canals, lawns & beds slope to a ha-ha.
